title: Digital Tools in Open Educational Design: DBIR and OER Practices

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and general understanding of language learning
context.additional_context: Learners primarily use smartphones as their main tool, requiring collaborative learning that utilizes open educational resources and visual design tools.

learning_goals: Learners can design language learning activities step-by-step by applying the DBIR (Data-Based Instructional Redesign) methodology.
Learners can create and share visual learning design materials using OER-based digital tools.
Learners can complete open educational practice cases reflecting peer feedback through project-based assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
